newsitem.title: UK: IBCA rates Tat Lee Bank individual B/C.
newsitem.headline: IBCA rates Tat Lee Bank individual B/C.

text.p: IBCA, the European credit rating agnecy, said on Thursday it had assigned an individual rating of B/C and a legal rating of 4 to Singapore's Tat Lee Bank.
Tat Lee is the smnallest bank in Singapore and is family controlled although the government owns around 25 percent of the bank, IBCA said in a statement.
"Tat Lee Bank is the least profitable bank in Singapore but has an adequate overall financial profile, the agency said.
"The mediocre profitability results from two factors: a high cost structure related to a relatively large branch network and a high tax burden."
It said Tat Lee's adequate overall financial profile was a reflection of high capitalisation rather than profitability.

"Its equity/assets ratio is the highest among Singapore banks. Based on a high equity/loans ratio and its housing loan book, IBCA estimates the bank's Tier1 risk weighted capital adequacy ratio to be at least 25 percent," IBCA said.
A bank's individual rating is an evaluation of its financial strength on the premise that it is independent and therefore unable to rely on support from state authorities or its owners.

IBCA's Legal ratings are evaluated on the basis of the likelihood of support from owners or government authorities if it ran into difficulties. A Legal rating of 4 indicates that support is likely but not certain.
